sect2.title: Introduction to libusb
sect2.para: The libusb package contains a library used by some applications for USB device access.

sect2.title: Configuring libusb
sect2.para: libusb requires the usbfs kernel filesystem to be mounted on /proc/bus/usb. Applications require the files in this directory to be accessible to the user, sometimes for both reading and writing.
To restrict access to USB devices, create the usb group:

Mount usbfs at system boot-up using a special init script, as putting an extra line into /etc/fstab does not work for those who compiled "USB device filesystem" as a kernel module. Install the /etc/rc.d/init.d/usb init script included in the package:

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The libusb package contains libusb libraries, the /usr/include/usb.h header, and a usb-config script.

sect3.title: libusb libraries
sect3.para: libusb libraries contain C functions for accessing USB hardware.

sect3.title: usb-config
sect3.para: The usb-config script provides the right compiler and linker flags for programs using this library.
